Package com.lambdaschool.schools.controllers

Class StudentController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.lambdaschool.schools.controllers.StudentController
  • @RestController
@RequestMapping("/students")
public class StudentController
extends java.lang.Object
    The entry point for clients to work primary with student data

    • Method Detail

      • listAllStudents

        @GetMapping(value="/students",
            produces="application/json")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> listAllStudents()
        Returns a list of all students
        Example: http://localhost:2019/students/students
        Returns:
        JSON list of all students with a status of OK
        See Also:
        StudentService.findAll()

      • getStudentById

        @GetMapping(value="/student/{studentId}",
            produces="application/json")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getStudentById​(@PathVariable
                                                                 java.lang.Long studentId)
        Returns a single user based off a student id number
        Example: http://localhost:2019/students/student/7
        Parameters:
        studentId - The primary key of the student you seek
        Returns:
        JSON object of the student you seek
        See Also:
        StudentService.findStudentById(long)

      • addStudentUser

        @PostMapping(value="/student",
             consumes="application/json")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> addStudentUser​(@Valid @RequestBody
                                                                 @Valid Student newStudent)
                                                          throws java.net.URISyntaxException
        Given a complete student Object, create a new student record and student course records.
        Example: http://localhost:2019/students/student
        Parameters:
        newStudent - A complete new student to add including enrolled courses. Courses must already exist.
        Returns:
        A location header with the URI to the newly created student and a status of CREATED
        Throws:
        java.net.URISyntaxException - Exception if something does not work in creating the location header
        See Also:
        StudentService.save(User)

      • updateFullstudent

        @PutMapping(value="/student/{studentid}",
            consumes="application/json")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> updateFullstudent​(@Valid @RequestBody
                                                                    @Valid Student updateStudent,
                                                                    @PathVariable
                                                                    long studentid)
        Given a complete student Object Given the student id, primary key, is in the student table, replace the student record, student course combinations.
        Example: http://localhost:2019/students/student/15
        Parameters:
        updateStudent - A complete student including all students. Students and Instructor must already exist.
        studentid - The primary key of the student you wish to replace.
        Returns:
        status of OK
        See Also:
        StudentService.save(Student)

      • deleteStudentById

        @DeleteMapping("/student/{id}")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> deleteStudentById​(@PathVariable
                                                                    long id)
        Deletes a given student along with associated student course enrollments
        Example: http://localhost:2019/students/students/14
        Parameters:
        id - the primary key of the student you wish to delete
        Returns:
        Status of OK
        See Also:
        StudentService.delete(long)
